data.title: Ivo Andrić – Bibliography
data.meta_description: The Nobel Prize in Literature 1961 was awarded to Ivo Andrić "for the epic force with which he has traced themes and depicted human destinies drawn from the history of his country"
data.text:
Ivo Andrić

Bibliography

Works in Serbocroatian Ex Ponto. – Zagreb : Knjizevni jug, 1918 Nemiri. – Zagreb : Sv. Kugli, 1920 Put Alije Đerzeleza. – Beograd : S. B. Cvijanovic, 1920 Pripovetke I. – Beograd : Srpska knjizevna zadruga, 1924 Pripovetke. – Beograd : Srpska knjizevna zadruga, 1931 Pripovetke II. – Beograd : Srpska knjizevna zadruga, 1936 Izabrane pripovetke. – Sarajevo : Svjetlost, 1945 Na Drini ćuprija. – Beograd : Prosveta, 1945 Travnièka hronika. – Beograd : Drzavni izdavaèki zavod Jugoslavije, 1945 Gospodjica. – Sarajevo : Svjetlost, 1945 Most na Zepi : pripovetke. – Beograd : Prosveta, 1947 Pripovijetke. – Zagreb : Matica Hrvatska, 1947 Nove pripovetke. – Beograd : Kultura, 1948 Prièa o vezirovom slonu. – Zagreb : Nakladni zavod Hrvatske, 1948 Prièa o kmetu Simanu. – Zagreb : Novo pokoljenje, 1949 Pod gradicem : pripovetke o zivotu bosanskog sela. – Sarajevo : Seljaèka knjiga, 1952 Prokleta avlija. – Novi Sad : Matica srpska, 1954 Panorama. – Beograd : Prosveta, 1958 Prièa o vezirovom slonu, i druge pripovetke. – Beograd : Rad, 1960 Sabrana djela Ive Andrica. – Beograd, 1963-1982. – 17 vol. Ljubav u kasabi : pripovetke. – Beograd : Nolit, 1966 Aska i vuk : pripovetke. – Beograd : Prosveta, 1968 Eseji i kritike. – Sarajevo : Svjetlost, 1976 Pisma (1912-1973) : privatna posta. – Novi Sad: Matica srpska, 2000 Selected translations into English The Bridge on the Drina / translated by Lovett F. Edwards. – New York : Macmillan, 1959 Bosnian Story / translated by Kenneth Johnstone . – New York: London House & Maxwell, 1959 Devil’s Yard / translated by Kenneth Johnstone. – New York : Grove, 1962 The Vizier’s Elephant : Three Novellas / translated by Drenka Willen. – New York : Harcourt, Brace & World, 1962 Bosnian Chronicle / translated by Joseph Hitrec. – New York : Knopf, 1963 The Woman from Sarajevo / translated by Joseph Hitrec. – New York: Knopf, 1965 The Pasha’s Concubine and Other Tales / translated by Hitrec. – New York : Knopf, 1968 Letters / translated and edited by Zelimir B. Jurièic. – Toronto: Serbian Heritage Academy, 1984 The Development of Spiritual Life in Bosnia under the Influence of Turkish Rule / translated by Zelimir B. Jurièic and John F. Loud. – Durham, N.C. : Duke University Press, 1990 Conversation with Goya; Bridges; Signs / translated by Celia Hawkesworth and Andrew Harvey. – London: University of London, 1992 The Damned Yard and Other Stories, translated by Celia Hawkesworth and others. – London : Forest Books, 1992 The Days of the Consuls / translated by Celia Hawkesworth and Bogdan Rakic. – London : Forest Books, 1992 Critical studies (a selection) Dzadzic, Petar, Ivo Andric / translated into English by Marija Stansfild-Popovic. – Beograd, 1960 Popovic, Gordana, Ivo Andric : bibliografija dela, prevoda i literature. – Beograd, 1974 Karaulac, Miroslav, Rani Andric. – Beograd, 1980 Popovic, Radovan, Ivo Andric : Zivot. – Beograd, 1989 Mukerji, Vanita Singh, Ivo Andric : a Critical Biography. – London, 1990

The Swedish Academy, 2007

Nobel Prizes and laureates

Eleven laureates were awarded a Nobel Prize in 2023, for achievements that have conferred the greatest benefit to humankind. Their work and discoveries range from effective mRNA vaccines and attosecond physics to fighting against the oppression of women.

See them all presented here.
